website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for buyers seeking the convenience of a front zipper combined with high quality.
pros: Front-placed zipper makes the suit remarkably easy to take on and off
Double-lined neoprene makes suit incredibly durable
Customers appreciate the snug, warm fit
cons: Sizes tend to run a little small
Some women find the front zipper unflattering

customer_reviews.title: Pudgy older lady loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The front zip is what sold me, but I'm wearing it even in relatively warm water now. Makes every swim more comfortable! For sizing, I'm 5 ft 2 in, 145 lbs, apple-shaped 50ish woman, and the large fits me without serious tugging. I tried the Lido style by the same company, but it felt smaller with much less room in the chest. Ladies, whether you are snorkeling or doing water arobics, this is a very comfortable way to go -- coverage and warmth in one low-cost package. Extremely high quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Lars

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality but runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: I chose this suit because it had a front opening and I liked the design. It is good quality and nice thickness of material but unfortunately runs a little small. I am 5'7" and the length was what I expected but was a bit too tight. I normally wear a large or extra large depending on the manufacturer so the sizing isn't far off but I had to return this one and extra large was not an option. I would however; recommend trying the suit but I cannot speak to the ease/difficulty of pulling it on and off the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: yvey222

customer_reviews.title: Great Winter Snorkeling!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Wetsuit for my girlfriend for snorkeling here in Maui during the winter months. It really has extended her stay in the water from a comfortable 30 minutes and getting cold to not getting cold for hours. A beautiful suit and the front zipper was huge in my decision to purchase. The quality so far is great, the zipper large and smooth operating, easy to get in and out of. Honestly, she never wants a rear zipper unit again, as I always had to help her out of it. We get out about every weekend and this has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pace Brittain

customer_reviews.title: Unflattering, front zip suit.
customer_reviews.text: Wetsuits are are tight, bulky, and uncomfortable to begin with. Women's wetsuits are harder to fit and are often unflattering to the figure. Furthermore, it is difficult to find in bigger sizes. I ordered this suit because it had a front zip and came in a size 16, that I needed to accommodate my 38DDD bust and 170 pound frame. I did not like the fit or look on me. I also ordered a size 16 in another style that fit well and was quite figure flattering. So I know such wetsuits exist. I will be returning this suit. This wetsuit might fit somebody else just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Roxane

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for Swim Instructors
customer_reviews.text: I started teaching swim lessons this winter at my local rec center. After hours in the pool, I felt frozen. I bought this wetsuit mainly because it was cheap and I was desperate, but it’s been just fantastic!! Keeps me warm, lovely and thick, attractive and well made. The zipper in the front makes it easier to remove and no fear of the zip breaking this century, it’s an industrial sized zipper!! Well worth every penny. When this suit wears out, I’ll be getting a duplicate from Cressi.
customer_reviews.author: Gerianne B

customer_reviews.title: Great wetsuit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for early spring and fall slalom skiing in central Wisconsin when water temps are between 60-70 degrees. I haven't had a chance to use it in the water, but I will update my review as soon as I do. As for fit, I was nervous ordering it after reading the reviews, but I followed the size chart and it is a perfect fit. For reference, I am 5'5" 145lbs, athletic build, 36C/28in waist, and the Large was perfect. It is a tight fit, but does not hinder movement at all and I am able to get it on and off by myself :)
customer_reviews.author: Star79

customer_reviews.title: Breathing easier
customer_reviews.text: I tried on a lot of shorties and none worked like my old back-zippered 3 mil Bare from the 90s. Most pull at the crotch or choke me at the neck. I saw someone wearing a similar Cressi and she liked the looser v-shaped neck that actually let's you breathe. Front zips are a little harder to get in and out of, but no biggie. This suit fits okay -- not great, but whatdya want for 60 bucks? I'd prefer 3 mil, but this is fine for warm water diving and snorkeling. I have to tug it into place now and then, but I'm hoping it will adjust more to my form over time. Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: PeeWee 278

customer_reviews.title: 5'4" 154 lb Got a XL

It fits a tiny bit bunched up in tummy area which I think it's a bit long for my short little frame but it doesn't feel bad. I think a large would of been nightmarishly to tight till I lose some poundage *rolls eyes*

product_meta.title: Shorty Women's Wetsuit for Scuba Diving, Snorkeling, Windsurfing - 2.5mm Neoprene | PLAYA by Cressi: quality since 1946
product_meta.description: The 2.5mm Playa front-zip short wetsuit slides on with ease and provides core warmth and maximum mobility for all water sports. It can be used for diving in tropical water, swimming, sailing, and more. Made with high-quality double lined neoprene, the Playa retains its shape while providing insulating ability at depth. The YKK front-zipper makes it easy to put on and take off. The arms and legs feature ultraspan neoprene seals to minimize the entrance of water. This wetsuit is light and easy to put on and take off, leaving the wearer free to move. Features separate anatomical cuts for men and women to help ensure a perfect fit. The Playa is designed in Italy by Cressi and made in Cambodia. Cressi has been an Italian brand pioneer in scuba diving, snorkeling, and swimming equipment since 1946. This product is covered by a 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Cressi is a REAL diving, snorkeling and swimming Italian brand, since 1946.
Front-zip Shorty Wetsuit ideal for snorkeling, swimming, and other water related activities
The Front-Zip make really easy the donning and doffing.
Made in 2.5mm double-lined Neoprene that ensure warmth and durability.
Elastic Ultraspan Neoprene braided seal on arms and legs to keep water out.
